content:
{{knowledge objective

|Item_parent=Gait and balance disorders
|Item_parent_short=Gait and balance disorders
|Rank=A
|Title=Know how to diagnose lameness (clinical examination, diagnostic approach)
|Description=Clinical and video evidence in favour of a lameness in dodging, saluting and Trendelebourg.
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=
|Order=5}}
Clinical and video evidence in favour of eschewing, saluting and Trendelebourg lameness

properties.question: What is the correct clinical observation to diagnose lameness in a horse during a clinical examination?
properties.option_b: Absence of lameness during dodging and Trendelebourg
properties.option_c: Visible discomfort when trotting on hard ground
properties.option_d: Normal gait observed during all activities
